issue_obverse_figure_s: Right profile of Ohrmazd I on frontal bust
issue_obverse_figure_description_s: crown cap; covered korymbos; upper ribbons pointing upwards; plain diadem, diadem ribbons commencing above ball of hair pointing upwards; above diadem row of waves; earring consisting of two elements; tunica, neck-line edged with pearl row; dotted border
issue_obverse_legend_s: 11 h l. o. mzdysn bgy hwrmzdy ('whrmzdy) MRKAn MRKA 'yr'n W 'nyr'n MNW ctry MN yzd'n| mazdēsn bay Ohrmāzd šāhān šāh Ērān ud Anērān kē čihr az yazdān|"The Mazda-worshiping divine Ohrmazd, King of Kings of the Iranians and non-Iranians, whose seeds/splendour is from the gods; dot between diadem ribbons and upper ribbons
issue_reverse_figure_description_s: base consisting of two elements; round altar shaft; four altar slabs; altar flames depicted with parallel strockes; to the left of the altar attendant with stylized crown of Ohrmazd I, holding barsom in both hands, to the right of the altar attendant with stylized crown of Anahita, holding barsom in both hands, both facing inwards, dotted border
issue_reverse_legend_s: 3 h l i. 'hwrmzdy, 9 h l. o. NWRA ZY| ādur ī Ohrmāzd|“the fire of Ohrmazd”; symbol on altar shaft (SNS 3, var.25), dot to the left and right of altar shaft
